articles.title: About this site
articles.description: Some additional details about the website
articles.contents:
R can be fun to teach and learn.
I have planned these lessons to teach my year 9 girls who are very enthususiastic to learn how to build their website using R coding.
The steps are easy to follow and simple.
Enjoy building your own website.ğŸ˜„

Lesson 1
Learning Objectives
Opening an account at Github
Opening a new repository and naming it
Getting code from Github and creating a new R project
Installing package (â€œdistillâ€)
Create website
Step 1: Sign in on Positcloud
Step 2: Open Github account
Open an account with Github.
Create a new repository

Step 3: Name it
Be careful as this name will be part of your website
Tick readme box

Step 4: Clone repo
Copy the code at Github (the URL)
green code button and copy URL

Step 5: New project
Go to R positcloud and open new project (from Git Repository)
Add the code that you copied at Github

Step 6: Setup R
Open R and change view settings and appearance.
Tools-> global options > R markdown > view in viewer pane
Step 7: Install distill
Close and open project again
Install â€œdistillâ€ using this code (type in console) install.packages(â€œdistillâ€) click enter
Then type this code library(distill) click enter
Go to packages and check if there is a â€˜tickâ€™ next to the distill box

Step 7: Create website
Type this code in consule, write the name of your website
create_website(dir = â€œ.â€, title =â€œname of your websiteâ€, gh_pages = TRUE)
First change the title of your website and then click â€œenterâ€ to run code
Your website is now ready to view. We will learn about layouts next lesson.

Lesson 2
Learning objectives:
Find a good layout for your website
Change the title at yaml
Add video link and images to pages
Change layout of text
Add emoji to website
Step 1: Choose layout
Choose a layout/template from this website
Seankross postcards
Add this code to console: install.packages(â€œpostcardsâ€)
Step 2: Delete old index file
Tick index.rmd in files
Delete index.rmd file in the â€˜Fileâ€™ tab
Step 3:Create layout
Add this code to console with your chosen template
create_article(file =â€œindexâ€, template= â€œtrestlesâ€, package = â€œpostcardsâ€)
Click on index.rmd from the file list on the right of screen
Go to top left window
Copy this code and paste after output in new line:
site: distill::distill_website
â€¢ This creates the template for the homepage
â€¢ Now this is our new homepage
â€¢ Change title
â€¢ Knit to see a preview of just the homepage
Step 4: Add images to R
Go to bottom right window â€œFilesâ€
Make a new folder and name it â€œImagesâ€
Upload any pictures inside folder
Change image â€œimages/name of image.jpgâ€ on top of index.rmd page.
To add picture on any page use this format:
[title of image] (images/name of pic.jpg)
Add video (from YouTube) to R
Open a Youtube video
Click â€œshareâ€ and then â€œembedâ€ then copy code
Add code to your page

Step 5: Insert all your information into pages
Change layout of page using these symbols
For title (bigger font) use # biggest ,## smaller, ### smaller
For bold use before and after
For italics use before and after
Step 6: To insert emoji
Run this code
install.packages(â€œdevtoolsâ€)
then this
devtools::install_github(â€œhadley/emoâ€)
Now you can add emoji like this:
ğŸ˜„
For more names visit this page
